lines.text: Nóis não vai recuar, porquê
lines.translation: We will not back down, because
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Verb focus: recuar (check person/tense and prefixes). Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'We will not back down, because'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Tá na paz de Deus
lines.translation: He's at peace with God.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Identify the main verb, its ending, and any prefix movement. Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'He's at peace with God.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Que permaneça essa tranquilidade na comunidade, uh
lines.translation: May this tranquility remain in the community, uh
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Identify the main verb, its ending, and any prefix movement. Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'May this tranquility remain in the community, uh'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Peço a lili' dos amigo que estão privado, lili'
lines.translation: I ask for the lili' of the friends who are deprived, lili'
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Identify the main verb, its ending, and any prefix movement. Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'I ask for the lili' of the friends who are deprived, lili''. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.

lines.text: Saudade bate no meu peito dos cria que não estão mais aqui, aqui
lines.translation: My heart aches with longing for the children who are no longer here.
lines.grammar: Portuguese note: Verb focus: bate (check person/tense and prefixes). Contractions with articles; clitic pronouns may attach; nasal endings common. Meaning: 'My heart aches with longing for the children who are no longer here.'. Highlight any set phrase to memorize and how the verb agrees with the subject.
